intro: Casearia loheri, commonly known as the Loher’s casearia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dry fruits that contain one or two seeds. Casearia loheri is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and understorey habitats.
